greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, a(n) = 4*a(A252463(n)) + (n mod 4).
comment: a(n) encodes in its base-4 representation the succession of modulo 4 residues obtained when map x -> A252463(x), starting from x=n, is iterated down to the eventual 1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1024
program: from sympy import factorint, prevprime, prod
return 1 if n == 1 else prod(prevprime(i)**f[i] for i in f if i != 2)
def a252463(n): return 1 if n==1 else n//2 if n%2==0 else a064989(n)
def a(n): return 1 if n==1 else 4*a(a252463(n)) + n%4
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 51)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Sep 21 2017
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 15 2017
